title: The Wave, Muscat’s Leigh McMillan joins British America’s Cup team
text:
The Wave, Muscat’s Leigh McMillan joins British America’s Cup team The Wave, Muscat skipper Leigh McMillan By Ashok Purohit October 18, 2015 
Leigh McMillan, the skipper of Oman Sail's The Wave, Muscat (TWM) that currently leads the 2015 Extreme Sailing Series (ESS), is all set for a fresh challenge after joining British America’s Cup challenger Land Rover Ben Ainslie Racing (BAR) as a helmsman. 
Sailing legend Ben Ainslie is the skipper and team principal of the BAR crew. 
McMillan is considered one of the world’s top multihull sailors over the last decade and won the inaugural Bullitt GC32 Racing Tour in foiling multihulls with Oman Sail's Sultanate of Oman this season. 
The Briton has led TWM to two ESS titles and is in pole position to clinch a hat-trick when the Oman Sail team competes in the eighth and final Act in Sydney, Australia in December. 
TWM leads the 2015 leaderboard with 67 points following wins in five of the seven Acts. SAP Extreme Sailing Team is second with 56 points, while Red Bull Sailing Team is third with 54 points.. 
McMillan learned his trade in the Olympic Tornado class, with two appearances for Team GB at the Games in 2004 Athens and 2008 Beijing, and went on to build his reputation with success in the stadium racing format of the ESS. 
After the Beijing Olympics, McMillan rejoined the circuit, racing for various teams before joining Oman Sail mid-season in 2011. 
McMillan is excited about the new challenge. “I’m just looking forward to the next two years, that’s all I’m focused on right now,” he said. 
“I’m fully pumped up for this (America’s Cup) and I want to give it everything I can to make a difference. I want to push Ben as hard as I can, give the best possible input and feedback to the team. I’ve known Ben for a long time and having seen his success, I want to be a part of it over the next two years, helping bring the Cup home.” 
McMillan’s dominance in the ESS makes him the perfect sparring partner for Ainslie. 
Speaking to the media, Jono Macbeth, BAR's team manager, said, “Leigh’s ability to win consistently in multihulls made him the obvious choice to join the team.” Similar content
